channel.title: Half-life for mobile
channel.description:
Hello, I am the developer of half-life for mobile ([url]https://www.moddb.com/games/half-life-mobile[/url]) But I'd like to do BMS, there were no problems with Valve. Black Mesa for mobile....
[url]https://hl-mobile.com/[/url]

item.title: Half-life for mobile
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
the kurok engine runs HL maps and has an android port, the problem with that is there are no binds for +use and +jump

Read full topic

item.title: Half-life for mobile
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
Quake 2 is playable at approx 24 fps on my Galaxy nexus.
This is definitely doable but you’re gonna need a titbus of free time

Read full topic

item.title: Half-life for mobile
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
It seems like for making a mobile HL it would be better performance-wise to use one of the custom Quake 1 open source engines that have support for some of Half-Life’s features and code the rest in that would be needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Half-life for mobile
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
sersoft:

The GoldSrc engine is barely playable(5-10fps) in low resolution with no sound, on a quad-core android device like the Note 2. (search youtube for Half Life Dosbox Turbo)

The unity engine has support for multiple map/texture/model format but doesn’t have all the triggers/scripts/entities that a singleplayer valve game needs to be playable, so I’d say short of importing a client/server dll, you need to figure out x86 emulation or compile the source engine source code on ARM to make it playable within the current devices lifetime…

You can alter Unity a lot, can’t you? Doesn’t KSP run run on Unity?

Read full topic
